title: The Adze and the chainsaw
creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Tom Williamson and Pat McGuire
brief_description: Explores the question of whether Maori art should retain its traditional forms, or reflect changing experiences and new influences. Sequences include students making murals combining Maori legends with modern day experiences and the restoration of carvings using new techniques under the supervision of a traditional Maori artist. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels. Camera by Bayly Watson, edited by Ross Chambers, researched by Judith Wright.
